issue.title: PoC for UDFs
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15636](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15636). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The idea is to do a proof of concept before developing the UDF API or required kernels as a PR. 

This PoC will be looking into a few ideas. 
 \* Using Project (ProjectNodeOptions) to execute a simple Python function which serves as a UDF
 \* Using Aggregate (AggregateNodeOptions) to execute a simple Python function which servers as a UDF

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15636?focusedCommentId=17489893) by Vibhatha Lakmal Abeykoon (vibhatha):*
Note: This is not supposed to be a mergable PR, but just for the evaluation and brainstorming to identify limitations and required tools to designing UDFs.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15636?focusedCommentId=17490279) by Vibhatha Lakmal Abeykoon (vibhatha):*
In this task, the objective is to evaluate the existing API and limitations for the UDF design. 
A few tasks which are mainly focused; 
 \* How to use the existing function API and registry to register UDFs
 \* Evaluate the usage of ProjectNode and AggregateNode to provide UDFs 
 \* Finalize the API and initial design for UDFs.
